title: Quiz 3: Puerperium & eMTCT
description: Evaluation of postnatal physiological changes, care protocols, and Elimination of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV.

questions.question: Match the type of Lochia with its description and timing:
questions.explanation: Rubra is red (blood), Serosa is pink/brown (serum), Alba is white/yellow (leucocytes/mucus).
questions.hint: Rubra sounds like 'Red', Alba sounds like 'Albino' (white).

questions.question: By the end of the first week postpartum, the uterus weighs approximately:
questions.explanation: The uterus weighs ~900g after labour. It loses ~50% weight in the first week, reducing to ~450g.
questions.hint: It loses about half its weight in the first week.

questions.question: Which of the following are components of the 4-Pronged Approach to eMTCT? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Primary prevention of HIV infection in women
Prevention of unintended pregnancies in HIV+ women
Care and support of infected women and families

questions.explanation: The 4 prongs are: 1. Primary prevention, 2. Preventing unintended pregnancy, 3. Preventing transmission (medical), 4. Care/Support.
questions.hint: Think about the holistic approach from prevention to care.

questions.question: Infant prophylaxis with Nevirapine syrup should continue for ___BLANK___ weeks for infants whose mothers are on HAART.
questions.explanation: Current guidelines recommend NVP prophylaxis for 12 weeks for infants born to mothers on HAART.

questions.question: Order the schedule for infant HIV testing (PCR) for an HIV-exposed infant:
questions.explanation: Testing is done at 6 weeks, 6 months, 1 year, and confirmed at 18 months.
questions.hint: Start with the earliest vaccination visit.

questions.question: The 'taking hold' phase of puerperium is when the mother is passive and dependent on others for care.
questions.explanation: This describes the 'taking in' phase. The 'taking hold' phase is when the mother strives for independence and takes initiative in care.

questions.question: What is the term used to describe the process where the muscle fibers of the uterus digest their own protoplasm to reduce in size?
questions.explanation: Autolysis is the proteolytic digestion of muscle fibers responsible for uterine involution.
questions.hint: Auto means self, lysis means breakdown.
